b"About Dexcom

Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. provides continuous glucose monitoring technology to help patients and their clinicians better manage diabetes. Since our inception, we have focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions for people with diabetes - while empowering our community to take control of diabetes.

Summary

The Senior Manager Biostatistics Data Scientist sits at the intersection of new market commercial and clinical strategy. This role will significantly contribute to the New Markets organization and inform clinical and business strategy by developing a deep understanding of device performance and effectiveness.

About New Markets

Recently formed, the New Markets organization is an expanding, fully-dedicated team focused on creating significant value by driving Dexcom\xe2\x80\x99s world-class continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) technology into new applications, such as non-intensive type 2 diabetes, prediabetes, the hospital and managed care facilities, and pregnancy (including gestational diabetes). These important initiatives are entrepreneurial by nature, as they may require novel go-to-market strategies and new technologies. Each member of this team will play a critical role in helping the New Markets organization first explore then realize the significant potential that exists within these exciting new opportunities.

Functional Description

Manages the design, development and programs methods, processes, and systems to consolidate and analyze unstructured, diverse \xe2\x80\x9cbig data\xe2\x80\x9d sources to generate actionable insights and solutions for client services and product enhancement. May lead the product and service teams to identify questions and issues for data analysis and experiments. Develops and codes software programs, algorithms and automated processes to cleanse, integrate and evaluate large datasets from multiple disparate sources. Identifies meaningful insights from large data and metadata sources; interprets and communicates insights and findings from analysis and experiments to product, service, and business managers.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

As a dedicated member of the New Markets organization, the Sr Manager Biostatistics Data Scientist will:
Work closely with the New Markets team to translate clinical and commercial questions into a structured analysis plan, formulate and test hypotheses using quantitative analysis (descriptive, statistical), visualizations and algorithms (machine learning), and provide meaningful insights and strategic recommendations to R&D for product development and commercialization.
Will use techniques from machine learning and statistical analysis on data (e.g.: continuous glucose data, Payor Claims, Hospital EHR data) to build knowledge of device accuracy and optimal utilization, patient behavior and care utilization.
Provide subject matter expertise to clinical study designs, statistical analysis and data outputs for clinical trials. Lead study statistical design, sample size calculations, development of statistical analysis plans, data review, and query management.
Optimize clinical systems and processes as they relate to clinical statistics including review of CRF and data base structures, senior review of database locks and validation of statistical analyses macro/programs.
Develop and execute statistical analysis plans in collaboration with CRO statisticians based on input from cross-functional study team and participate with Operations in the selection and management of statistics and data management suppliers (CROs) to include leading project timelines.
Collaborate with Regulatory Affairs, Clinical Affairs Biostatisticians and other data scientists to interact and communicate with FDA regarding regulatory submissions.
Conduct statistical analyses and discussions for abstracts and manuscripts including drafting analyses, findings and reports.


Required Qualifications
A proven passion for generating insights from data, with a strong familiarity with the higher-level trends in data growth, open-source platforms, and public data sets.
Strong knowledge of biostatistical methods generally and data modeling.
Experience with open-source statistical languages and packages such as R and Python packages.
Experience working with relational databases and query languages (e.g. SQL, MapReduce, PIG, and Hive)
Working knowledge with open source cloud tools for big data analysis (e.g. Hortonworks Data Platform, Hive, Spark, Jupyter Notebook and Jupyter Lab).
